intro: Trachyandra affinis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved flat sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, commonly known as the sedge family. The plant is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in dense, spike-like clusters. Trachyandra affinis typically grows in wet or seasonally wet environments, such as marshes and swampy areas. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing wetland soils and providing habitat for various invertebrates.
